org_midgardproject_projectsite_product.title: Midgard MVC
org_midgardproject_projectsite_product.content: <p>Midgard MVC is a web framework for PHP. Being a framework, it provides a standard way to build and deploy web applications. Your applications provide a set of interfaces that Midgard MVC calls when a matching HTTP request is made.</p><p>Midgard MVC can be used with the <a href="/midgard2/">Midgard2</a> Content Repository, but it also works without it.</p><div><h2>Basic building blocks:</h2></div><div><ul><li><b>Application:</b> a configuration file describing the components and other settings used in a Midgard MVC website</li><li><b>Component:</b> a PHP module intended to run as part of a web application. For example: a news listing. Provides routes, controllers and templates</li><li><b>Library:</b> a PHP module that can be called by other modules to perform some task. Does not run as part of a website. For example: a form validation library</li><li><b>Service:</b> a standardized interface to access a given functionality. For example: authentication</li><li><b>Provider:</b> a standardized interface to access given information. For example: hierarchy. The difference between Services and Providers is that Services perform tasks while Providers merely provide access to a particular type of data</li></ul></div>
